fields.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
The ID for the compensation grade.  This is the index for the compensation grade and will be autopopulated if left blank.
The effective date of this salary grade.  We recommend using a date of 1900-01-01.  If not date is supplied, today's date will be used.
The unique salary grade name. Salary grades provide the guidelines for employee's base compensation.
The description of this salary grade.
The compensation elements that define base bay for this compensation grade.
The compensation eligibility rules associated with this compensation grade.
Number of Pay Range Segments can be specified as 3,4, or 5.
The minimum of the salary range.
The midpoint of the salary range.
The maximum of the salary range.
The spread from the range minimum to range maximum.
The top value for Segment 1.
The top value for Segment 2.
The top value for Segment 3.
The top value for Segment 4.
The top value for Segment 5.

Specifies if the amount in the compensation steps can be overriden when assigned to an employee.
Compensation Step
This is a wrapper for the Compensation Grade Profiles
The Setup Security Segment the Compensation Grade is assigned to.
When compensation steps are included in the Grade or Grade Profile, this indicator will be used to assign the first step to an employee when proposing compensation.

Inactive status indicator for Compensation Plans and Guideline components.
This is a wrapper for the Alternative Pay Range Data
Include Inactive indicates the response will also include inactive Compensation Plans and Guideline components.

Allow_Override.description: Specifies if the amount in the compensation steps can be overriden when assigned to an employee.

Alternative_Pay_Range.description: This is a wrapper for the Alternative Pay Range Data

Assign_First_Step_During_Compensation_Pr.description: When compensation steps are included in the Grade or Grade Profile, this indicator will be used to assign the first step to an employee when proposing compensation.

Effective_Date.description: The effective date of this salary grade.  We recommend using a date of 1900-01-01.  If not date is supplied, today's date will be used.

Eligibility_Rule_Reference.description: The compensation eligibility rules associated with this compensation grade.

Number_of_Segments.description: Number of Pay Range Segments can be specified as 3,4, or 5.
